book.bookinfo:
Eclipse Rich Client Platform The complete guide to Eclipse application development
Lars Vogel
2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 Lars Vogel
10.03.2016
Third edition
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../001_Books_Shared/legalnotice.adoc[]

part.title: The concepts behind Eclipse and Eclipse based applications
part.chapter: Introduction to the Eclipse project <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipsePlatformDevelopment/011_foundation.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/010_overview.adoc[]

Architecture of Eclipse
The following chapter gives an overview of the Eclipse architecture, explains the term plug-ins and what extensions and extension points are.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/020_architecture.adoc[]

Using a target platform for development <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseTargetPlatform/010_overview.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseTargetPlatform/012_definition.adoc[]

part.title: Setting up an Eclipse RCP development environment
part.chapter: Install Java for Eclipse RCP development <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/016_installationrequirements.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../JavaIntroduction/012_installation.adoc[]

Install Eclipse IDE for RCP development
Installation
The following description explains how to install the Eclipse IDE and the required tools to develop Eclipse RCP applications.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/040_download_eclipsesdk.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/020_installation.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/022_gettingstarted.adoc[]

Install the e4 tools
Requirements
To install the tools required for Eclipse RCP development you need to know how to use the Eclipse update manager. Open
Help Install new software...
for this.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/042_tutorial_installation_e4tools.adoc[]
Exercise: Enable Java access to all plug-ins <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseCodeAccess/032_addtosearch.adoc[]

part.title: Creating and exporting Eclipse applications
part.chapter:
The usage of run configurations
This chapter describes the usage of the run configuration and highlights typical problems with them.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/090_runconfiguration.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/091_runconfiguration_product.adoc[]

Deployment of your RCP application <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/020_deployment.adoc[]
More about the target platform
See
for more information about the target platform configuration.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/022_deployment.adoc[]

Exercise: Create and run an RCP application <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/044_tutorial_first.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/140_exercise_feature.adoc[]

part.title: Application model
part.chapter: Model objects and the runtime application model <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/140_modelelements.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/122_uiconcepts.adoc[]

Using the model spy
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse4LiveModelEditor/010_overview.adoc[]
Installation requirements
The usage of the model spy requires the installation of the Eclipse 4 - Core Tools as described in
.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse4LiveModelEditor/012_ide.adoc[]

Exercise: From plug-in to Eclipse RCP
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/220_tutorial_e4_application.adoc[]

Exercise: Configure the deletion of persisted model data
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/239_tutorial_clearpersistence.adoc[]

Exercise: Enter the dependencies <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/242_tutorial_e4_dependencies.adoc[]
More on dependencies
The exact details of applying this modular approach is covered in
.
Exercise: Connect Java classes with the parts <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/244_tutorial_modelelemenentjava.adoc[]
Optional Exercise: Using the model spy <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse4LiveModelEditor/100_exercise.adoc[]

How context functions are implemented as OSGI services is described in
. The dedicated section
summarize the different approaches for communicating inside your application.

. An example implementation of multiple editors can be found in exercise

chapter.title: Extend the Eclipse application model
chapter.para: It is also possible to extend the application model. This requires knowledge about the Eclipse EMF framework. Describing EMF is currently out of scope for this book. See Extending the Eclipse 4 application model for an introduction into the concepts.

book.part:
Migrating Eclipse 3.x components and RCP applications
Why migrating an Eclipse 3.x RCP application? <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse4MigrationGuide/001_purpose.adoc[]
